short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Block specific songs from playing on Spotify Web Player

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This script is a game-changer for anyone who craves full control over their music listening experience. Imagine this: you're streaming your favorite playlist, but an unwanted song disrupts your vibe. Maybe it’s overplayed, a genre you dislike, or just something you don’t want to hear right now. With this script, that interruption becomes a thing of the past.

Here’s what it does:

    Real-Time Song Detection: The script monitors spotify and detects when a new song starts playing.
    Seamless Blocking: If the song matches your pre-defined "blocked songs" list, it skips it automatically—no manual intervention required. It’s like having a personal DJ who knows your tastes inside and out.
    Error-Proof Skipping: The script employs advanced retry logic to ensure the song gets skipped, even if the first attempt fails. This guarantees that your listening experience stays smooth and interruption-free.
    Smart Monitoring: Using a lightweight observer, it efficiently tracks changes to your music player without bogging down system performance.

Why Should You Install It?

    Effortless Control: No more fumbling for the skip button or being stuck with a song you don’t want. Your music, your rules—completely hands-free.
    Customizable Experience: Tailor your blocked list to your unique preferences. Whether it’s a cringe-worthy pop hit or a song that brings back unwanted memories, the script ensures you never hear it again.
    Enhanced Productivity: Stay in the zone without breaking focus to skip songs manually. This is especially valuable during workouts, study sessions, or deep work.
    Peace of Mind: With robust skip logic and intelligent error handling, you’ll never have to worry about annoying tracks ruining your playlist.

This is more than a script—it’s a revolution for your music listening freedom. Install it now and transform how you interact with your music. Because life’s too short for bad songs.
